title: RichText parser vulnerability in scheduled posts allows XSS

activities.message:
Hey @revolte,

Thank you for your report!

After review, there doesn’t seem to be any significant security risk and/or security impact as a result of the behavior you are describing.

This is not an XSS Vulnerability and above report doesn't have any security impact on the CIA Triad.

As a result, we will be closing this report as informative. If you are able to leverage this into a practical exploitation scenario, we will be happy to reevaluate this report.

This will not have any impact on your Signal or Reputation score. We appreciate your effort and look forward to seeing more reports from you in the future.

Kind regards,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

Hello, @h1_analyst_dmitry 
This is an XSS, because the attacker can submit a javascript in a href that would execute, this is not self-xss, since admins can view and interact with this payload, could you please explain why this isn't a security issue?

This is a clickable link by any admin, there could be any javascript code after javascript: compromising the target
{F2274718}

Hi @revolte,

I will review the report once again and would update you about status in sometime.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

Hi @revolte,

Could you please, share me the payload in order to replicate the given issue?

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

Hey @h1_analyst_dmitry ,

Sure, here is the request, just remember to replace the subreddit ID and session data:
```
POST / HTTP/2
Host: gql.reddit.com
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:102.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/102.0
Accept: */*
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 568
X-Reddit-Loid: █████████
X-Reddit-Session: █████████
X-Reddit-Compression: 1
Origin: https://www.reddit.com
Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
Sec-Fetch-Site: same-site
Authorization: █████████
Referer: https://www.reddit.com/
Te: trailers

{"id":"737d59db38fc","variables":{"input":{"collectionId":"","discussionType":"COMMENT","isContestMode":false,"isPostAsMetaMod":false,"isSpoiler":false,"isNsfw":false,"title":"TITLE_TEST_PAYLOAD","isOriginalContent":false,"flair":{},"subredditId":"YOUR_SUBREDDIT_ID(t5_xxx)","isSendReplies":true,"scheduling":{"publishAt":"2023-04-06T19:00:00","clientTimezone":"Europe/Moscow"},"content":{"richText":"{\"document\":[{\"e\":\"par\",\"c\":[{\"e\":\"link\",\"t\":\"CLICK_THE_LINK\",\"u\":\"javascript:alert(document.cookie)\"}]}]}"},"assetIds":[],"creationToken":"5409b9cd-e32e-4a89-b640-c829466c1805"}}}
```
Actually you can easily reproduce by just creating a new scheduled post and intercepting the request, where you replace content variable with following:
```"content":{"richText":"{\"document\":[{\"e\":\"par\",\"c\":[{\"e\":\"link\",\"t\":\"CLICK_THE_LINK\",\"u\":\"javascript:alert(document.cookie)\"}]}]}"}```

After sending the request navigate to https://www.reddit.com/r/{subreddit_name}/about/scheduledposts -> TITLE_TEST_PAYLOAD -> Edit -> Content of post -> Click "LICK_THE_LINK" -> Click the popped out link -> View javascript execution

Hi @revolte,

While trying to replicate the issue, I am getting a completely different access to the features. As I can see in your POC, you are scheduled post which doesn't seem to be present for me.

█████

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry
Also, I think you should use a real subreddit and not a profile page

Hi @h1_analyst_dmitry 
Any updates?

Hey @h1_analyst_dmitry 

> Also, I think you should use a real subreddit and not a profile page

Create a subreddit and post from it, not from profile
https://www.reddit.com/subreddits/create

Hey @h1_analyst_dmitry 

Seems like the issue with link is on your side since it works on my device. You can try to create a community and then post from it the following way:
Visit https://reddit.com 
Click Create Community
{F2286191}
Create a malicious scheduled post in new community following previous instructions

@h1_analyst_dmitry 

Any updates on the reproduction?

Hello, @h1_analyst_dmitry 
Which browser are you using? Seems like on Windows and Android javascript links with _blank require middle clicking with mouse to go off. Could you please check that by clicking with middle mouse? I am very confused since it has different behaviour in browsers.
Sorry for inconvinience.

Thanks for your patience

I can't find a lot about these behaviour but _blank in target causes some inconvenience, and you need to middle click POC link http://blog.dclabs.com.br/2021/05/the-curious-case-of-xss-and-mouse.html?m=1

Hi @revolte,

I'm currently using Firefox/Chrome on Mac to validate the given finding. However, in both cases the XSS doesn't get executed.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

@h1_analyst_dmitry 
Does it work if you middle click with scroll button on mouse? Very curious of this, it successfully shows in F12, javascript scheme is in link but blank target does something with it

Hi @revolte,

The given POC doesn't work with even hovering or middle click of mouse.

Thanks.
@h1_analyst_dmitry

Hey @h1_analyst_dmitry 
I will investigate this on VM and let you know about the results.
Sorry for inconvinience

Hi @revolte,

Till then I will change the state of report to NMI. 

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

Hey @h1_analyst_dmitry 

It seems like this only works in latest FireFox version, and other browser block javascript from executing in link with target=_blank, this is an inconsistent behaviour and this has changed a lot over the years according to the writeups from other people (e.g previous link), could you please tell the FireFox version you are using? Anyway, I think the ability to inject javascript in that href should be fixed in case any other changes appear in browsers policy about javascript links with _blank, at the moment, only firefox seems to be vulnerable
Note: This applies to all Chromium browsers
Any Updates?

Hi @revolte,

It is Windows OS.

Thanks,
@h1_analyst_dmitry

@h1_analyst_dmitry 
I am starting to have less and less ideas on why this is not working on your side. What version are you using? I am testing with Version 112.0.5615.121 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Also try Ctrl+Click once again and let me know your Chrome version so I can retest with it
Thank you
Perhaps you have a not classical keyboard layout with command key?
@revolte Thanks for help here, we are working to validate on our end. Will update you soon!

Hey @revolte, I was able to reproduce with recent version of Firefox, Chrome, and the Chromium installed in Burp. Looks like on MacOS with CMD + Click replicates similar functionality as your middle mouse wheel + Windows OS. Chromium and Chrome will print the cookie in the alert box, but Firefox does not. However, Firefox does print the domain via document.domain in lieu of document.cookie. 

Let me write something up for the dev team and discuss with them and rest of the security team internally. Will keep you posted on payout + severity.
Hey @revolte, changes should now be in prod. Mind retesting with a new scheduled post and see if it's possible?

Hey @les_oeufs,

Retested, now anything except allowed schemes will result in INVALID_REQUEST : Post body is not valid:
This is fixed
We are down to disclose in full if there's nothing sensitive here you want further redacted. Let me know :)

It's fine, everything has been redacted. 
Thank you, @les_oeufs!

summaries.content: Reddit's MarkDown parser wasn't filtering hyperlinks on server-side in scheduled post feature, which lets attacker to modify a request with normal hyperlink embeding a malicious link using javascript scheme
